title: I think this is a cause for concern. Fiora's Riposte seems far too strong.

body:
This is really strong. This is like Yasuo's Windwall except far better as it can block essentially any debuff; any champion or summoner spell ability.

I feel like this should toned down a little bit.

What do you guys think?
Is this "balanced"?
Should Fiora be able to negate (what seems like) every ability in the game?
What offensive abilities can Fiora not negate?

replies.body: As long as you dont toss all your spells at the same time, it should only ever be able to block one ability. Which isn't that different to sivir or nocturne spell shields. I'd liken it much more to these abilities than yasuos wind wall.
Ok this is complete BS, it has to be used almost perfectly to do its job and it has a long cool down, fio is also susceptible to being kited, shes not op

I never once used the word "OP" or "over-powered" in my threat/post. Nor did I ever mean to say that Fiora is OP.
The video narrator may have used it but I only use the video to show people the extent to what Fiora can do.

I am simply saying that it should be looked at by Riot. It's quite a strong ability if it can block ultimates the likes of Bard, Zed, Sejuani, Malzahar, Darius, Mordekaiser, etc.

Yes it is balanced as she has a 0.75 second window to use it. I see it being a problem in the higher elos Diamond-Challenger as they are gonna be able to time it perfectly but saying that their opponents would be aware and try and bait it out
